abstract: JPMorgan is the last bidder still in talks with Royal Bank of Scotland Group to buy its commodity-trading joint venture, R.B.S. Sempra, in a deal that could be worth $4 billion dollars, people familiar with the negotiations said.
snippet: JPMorgan is the last bidder still in talks with Royal Bank of Scotland Group to buy its commodity-trading joint venture, R.B.S. Sempra, in a deal that could be worth $4 billion dollars, people familiar with the negotiations said.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase is the last bidder still in talks with Royal Bank of Scotland Group  to buy its commodity-trading joint venture, R.B.S. Sempra, in a deal that could be worth $4 billion, people briefed on the negotiations told DealBook on Wednesday.

headline.main: JPMorgan Closes In on R.B.S. Sempra
